Field Detail

REQUEST_ENTITY_TYPE_PARAMETER

public static final int REQUEST_ENTITY_TYPE_PARAMETER
The request entity type for parameter. The client is allowed to send parameter list to server.It supports GET and POST mode. This function is mostly like the url parameter transfer as ("http://localhost:8080?key1=value1&key2=value2").

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REQUEST_ENTITY_TYPE_STRING

public static final int REQUEST_ENTITY_TYPE_STRING
The request entity type for string. The client is allowed to send string(Text, XML, JSON, Properties...) to server.It only supports POST mode.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REQUEST_ENTITY_TYPE_SERIALIZABLE

public static final int REQUEST_ENTITY_TYPE_SERIALIZABLE
The request entity type for serializable. The client is allowed to send serializable object to server.It only supports POST mode.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

doExecute

public void doExecute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                      String method)
               throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                      IOException
Executes the server invoker.

Parameters:
request - the instance of HttpServletRequest
response - the instance of HttpServletResponse
method - the method, the value should be GET or POST
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException
IOException

invoke

public Object invoke(Object requestObject,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
              throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                     IOException
Invokes the web server to get the serializable object. If it is overridden by the child class, the method will be executed.

Parameters:
requestObject - the request object
request - the instance of HttpServletRequest
response - the instance of HttpServletResponse
Returns:
the response object which should be serializabled
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException
IOException
